Of the four types of seasonal influenza viruses (IV) (A, B, C and D), A and B viruses cause seasonal epidemics of disease. Most cases of human influenza are clinically diagnosed as Influenza-like Illness (ILI) making differentiation from other winter circulating respiratory viruses such as rhinovirus, respiratory syncytial virus, parainfluenza and adenovirus difficult.
3 Yet those cases requiring hospitalizations because of a more severe outcome are laboratory tested and confirmed as severe cases of influenza infection that need to be hospital admitted.
